Data: Toss news: Pakistan have won the toss and will bat first. Massive cheer at the news of a winning toss!
Hussey to Shahzaib, no run few things could be more gentle than this off spin, but starts well enough, outside off and defended
Hussey to Shahzaib, no run driven firmly this time, but Hasan picked out cover
Hussey to Shahzaib, no run good move already by Clarke it seems, defended back to the bowler
Hussey to Shahzaib, OUT done it! David Hussey strikes! Not the most memorable shot you'll ever see, a massive heave-ho across the line and it crashes into the pads bang in front
Hussey to Kamran, no run still nothing off Hussey, Akmal prods it back to the bowler

Hussey to Kamran, no run wicket maiden to gets things off. Well done David Hussey. Kamran plays and misses outside off to Hussey, the first time Australia have ever opened with a spinner in T20 cricket. Is Hussey even a spinner?
Tait to Salman Butt, 1 wide starts by bolting down a wide outside off stump, Butt plays but can't reach it
Tait to Salman Butt, 1 run this is better, swift and on a good line, Butt works it to third man for a single
Tait to Kamran, no run first time he's gone for his usual full length, and it's blocked out firmly to mid on
Tait to Kamran, no run good stuff again from Tait, good length, tight line, Kamran gives himself a touch of room but defends
Tait to Kamran, FOUR runs width is a real no no in this form of the game, Tait gave Kamran space to free his arms and he threw absolutely everything at it, nailing it one-bounce to the point boundary
Tait to Kamran, no run tighter line this time and though Kamran swings a booming drive away, he finds the cover fielder
Tait to Kamran, 1 run has a leg-side fiddle for a couple ever been so loudly cheered? Brilliant noise out there
Nannes to Kamran, 1 run starts tidily, on a length outside off, Kamran drives but some swift sliding fielding at point keeps it to one
Nannes to Salman Butt, no run lovely bowling from Nannes, no fuss, just full and straight and Butt digs it out to midwicket
Nannes to Salman Butt, no run bouncer this time, it was angling down the leg side as well, Butt ducked underneath it, and would probably have hoped for a wide
Nannes to Salman Butt, FOUR runs good batting this, Butt's favourite boundary shot in this format, skipping leg side of the ball and banging it through cover for four
Nannes to Salman Butt, 2 runs nicely done, follows up the boundary with a couple of pure delicacy, dinking a guide down to fine third man
Nannes to Salman Butt, no run again Butt advanced down the track and outside leg, Nannes saw him coming and shoved it in slower and shorter, enough to prevent Butt from timing him off-side swipe
Johnson to Kamran, FOUR runs oops, real horrid loosener from Johnson, very shot and slow, sat up at Kamran who helped a pull shot all the way for six, good timing
Johnson to Kamran, 1 run Johnson goes full this time, slanting it across Kamran who slugs hard at it, gets a thick outside edge the sails one bounce to third man
Johnson to Salman Butt, FOUR runs this is turning into a good over for Pakistan, Johnson looking to cramp Butt, yet it's too close to leg stump and the batsman whips it through midwicket for four
Johnson to Salman Butt, no run lucky to get away with this Johnson, Butt creamed it through the covers but some swift diving fielding from O'Keefe at cover prevented runs
Johnson to Salman Butt, FOUR runs bang! Lovely shot again from Butt, through his favourite extra-cover area, giving himself a touch of room and scything it through the off side
Johnson to Salman Butt, 1 run single to finish the over, Butt just turning his wrists over the ball to clip it to midwicket for one
Nannes to Salman Butt, no run again Butt skips down the track and outside leg, can't quite time the 'drive' this time
Nannes to Salman Butt, no run this time Butt played from the crease, and actually timed it a lot better, but picked out the cover fielder
Nannes to Salman Butt, FOUR runs that'll do! You wouldn't say it was perfect timing but it's a safe shot, edging outside leg stump and slicing it miles over point for another boundary
Nannes to Salman Butt, 1 run good bowling from Nannes, banged in much shorter and following Butt as he disappeared outside leg, the batsman could only bang it without timing to mid off for a single
Nannes to Kamran, no run nothing on offer here for Akmal just blocked carefully
Nannes to Kamran, FOUR runs good finish and Pakistan are rolling! Short from Nannes, Akmal picked a gap behind square on the leg side and wheeled a pull shot away
Tait to Salman Butt, no run Butt was looking to give himself room again, but it was a touch too quick for Butt and he missed the attempted flay
Tait to Salman Butt, no run this time it's an old fashioned passage of play, on off stump on a good length, firmly blocked to mid off
Tait to Salman Butt, FOUR runs that is no place to be bowling with fine leg up in the circle, short and down the leg side, Butt helped it on its way for a boundary
Tait to Salman Butt, 1 wide full from Tait this time, but it's too far down the leg side
Tait to Salman Butt, 1 wide oh no, Tait is misfiring a touch here. Slung in short and wide down the leg side again
Tait to Salman Butt, 1 run after all that it's a slower ball, which is pretty smart from Tait, blocked into the covers for a quick single

Tait to Kamran, FOUR runs this won't improve Tait's mood, with no fine leg in place, Tait shoves in a short ball, Kamran happily swishes at it, getting a top-edge into the vacant fine-leg area and it bobbles over the rope for another four
Tait to Kamran, 2 runs fuller from Tait and Kamran looks for an extra-cover heave, ends up edging it safely over the infield for a couple
O'Keefe to Salman Butt, 1 run starts well enough, flighted up and around off stump, driven down the ground for one
O'Keefe to Kamran, 5 wide this won't please the debutant, sliding it down the leg side, Paine misses and it runs away for five wides
O'Keefe to Kamran, no run much better now, on a length and line and pushed to cover
O'Keefe to Kamran, no run good ball, shorter and quicker, rushed on to Kamran as he tried to pull, couldn't time it at all
O'Keefe to Kamran, 1 run this time Kamran does get a good connection, bunting it down the ground for a single
O'Keefe to Salman Butt, FOUR runs invention from Butt, reverse-paddle, and he played it well, getting four to third man
O'Keefe to Salman Butt, OUT gone this time! Silence in Birmingham! Butt tried to sweep firmly, but it got a top edge and looped towards White at short fine leg, who slid forward and held a good catch
Hussey to Kamran, 1 run good start from Hussey again, straight and on a good length, pushed to mid on
Hussey to Malik, 1 run Malik off the mark straight way, milking merrily down the ground for a single
Hussey to Kamran, 1 run Kamran this time plays a comfortable drive, finding deep cover
Hussey to Malik, no run dot ball, worked straight to the third man fielder
Hussey to Malik, no run good stuff again from Hussey, what a bonus he's been for Australia, pushed back to the bowler
Hussey to Malik, 1 run just a single here, worked towards long on
O'Keefe to Malik, no run good stuff from O'Keefe, spearing in a yorker that Malik digs out
O'Keefe to Malik, 1 run just a single here, the bowler doing a good job, clipped to midwicket
O'Keefe to Kamran, 2 runs Kamran trying to get after the new man, skips down the wicket and launches a big drive, that is not timed and finds long on for a couple
O'Keefe to Kamran, 1 run just a single again, worked into the leg side
O'Keefe to Malik, 1 run touch shorter, Malik finds just a single
O'Keefe to Kamran, no run short and darted in, attempted cut is not timed and finds point
Johnson to Malik, 1 wide poor start, really slung in with a low arm, dragged down short and wide of leg
Johnson to Malik, 1 run much better this time, on a good length and line, clipped towards square leg
Johnson to Kamran, no run good stuff from Johnson, slower ball, Kamran looking for something expansive but nothing on offer

Johnson to Kamran, SIX runs attempted slower ball, Kamran read it and murdered it down the ground where Hussey, leapt, took the ball and tried to parry it back in play before he landed outside the rope, almost pulled it off, but his foot was just in contact with the ground while he tried to parry it away - shades of his IPL catch there

Johnson to Kamran, OUT gone this time! Banged in short, Akmal tried to wheel an enormous pull shot away but got it very high on the bat, and it looped over midwicket where Clarke ran back to pull off an excellent catch
Johnson to Malik, 1 run very calmly done by Malik, dropped into the leg side for a single
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run good line and good length, Umar blocks his first ball back to the bowler
O'Keefe to Malik, no run driven to mid-off
O'Keefe to Malik, 2 runs flicked across the line to wide long-on, huge gaps on the leg side with fielders back
O'Keefe to Malik, 1 run darts one in at the pads as the batsman dances down the track, dropped close in and a quick single
O'Keefe to Umar Akmal, 1 run a touch short, and worked off the legs to midwicket
O'Keefe to Malik, 1 run Malik steps back and across and hacks across the line to send the ball down to long-on
O'Keefe to Umar Akmal, 1 run too straight, slipping down towards leg stump and nudged to long leg

Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run slower one, angling across Umar. He just seemed to roll the fingers over that one, and it gripped on the turf to beat the edge of the bat as Umar looked to guide to third man

Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run and he follows that up with a stinging bouncer that whizzes past the helmet as Umar tries to hook. Huge appeal from Paine, who appeared to think it brushed the glove, but he isn't joined by Johnson
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run another airy swish outside off, another play-and-miss
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 2 runs he lays bat on this one, chopping it down to third man, just wide of the fielder and they scamper back for the second

Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run Johnson's doing really well here, nice lines and good changes of pace. This was back-of-a-length, angling across him and Johnson finds some lift to beat the edge of an attempted cut again
Johnson to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs hooked down to fine leg! Umar swings the ball off his nose and down to fine leg as Johnson sends down another bouncer
Hopes to Malik, 1 run cutter, but well wide of off. Well played by Malik, playing a delicate late cut but the ball goes straight to the man at short third man

Hopes to Umar Akmal, no run Umar has almost swung himself off his feet now! Hopes sent one down full and wide and Umar aimed a massive hoick to leg, really throwing everything at the ball, but he toe-ends and loses balance
Hopes to Umar Akmal, 1 bye another huge swipe to leg, this time he misses completely but a fumble behind the stumps allows a bye
Hopes to Malik, 1 run swivel-pulled out to long leg

Hopes to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs neat little shot! It was Umar this time, and instead of trying to bludgeon with his head in the air he kept his eye on the ball and played a little paddle-sweep to dab the ball down and past the short fine leg fielder
Hopes to Umar Akmal, 2 runs drilled to wide long-on, and the fielder was right on the fence so they rush back for a second

Nannes to Malik, OUT he gets a wicket straight away! Nannes sent one down just short of a length at decent pace, Malik hops back to pull but the ball just rushes on to him and he ends up lapping it ever so tamely to mid-on. Really soft dismissal there, he won't be pleased... but the crowd are, because it brings Boom Boom to the crease!
Nannes to Afridi, no run very full, tapped to mid-on

Nannes to Afridi, FOUR runs off the mark with a boundary! More back-of-a-length stuff from Nannes, and Afridi just flat-bats it straight back down the track, perfectly bisecting long-off and long-on to pick up four
Nannes to Afridi, no run good response from Nannes, who sends down a pacy and well-directed bouncer. Afridi sways out of the way in a hurry
Nannes to Afridi, 1 run on the hips, pulled out to deep square-leg

Nannes to Umar Akmal, 1 run cracked straight at mid-off, but they set off straight away for a single. The fielder fires in a shy, but it's wide of the stumps. Umar was struggling there, would've been out by a yard

Johnson to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs sliced inside-out over cover, he didn't get all of that but it had the beating of the fielder out there! Umar looked just like his brother playing that shot, the wristy sliced lofted drive over cover. Nailed it.
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run Umar comes down the track and backs way over to leg. Johnson spots him coming and out-smarts him by sending down a full toss wide of off stump, which Umar can't reach
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run Umar stands at the crease this time, cracking another full toss straight to mid-off

Johnson to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs over mid-off this time! Sheer confidence from Umar, that was very full from Johnson on the off stump but he somehow managed to get underneath it to lift it over the infield. Not sliced like the last one, and went much straighter
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run yorker on off stump, Umar backs to leg and digs it out, angling the bat as he does so to send the ball out to cover point
Johnson to Afridi, 1 run Afridi wanders to leg and Johnson follows him, just a single the result as the ball is tapped down to third man

Tait to Afridi, no run aggression from Afridi straight away! But Tait is equal to it, and Boom Boom is saved by some movement in through the air as he backs to leg and misses a heave over mid-off. The ball would've clattered into leg stump if it hadn't swung in!
Tait to Afridi, 1 run more swing from Tait, this time a yorker on the off stump and Afridi jams it out to point
Tait to Umar Akmal, 1 run slower ball on a length outside off, Umar didn't quite pick it but re-adjusted to push the ball to long-off

Tait to Afridi, SIX runs dismissive and imperious! Shaun Tait steams in and hurls one down full at close to 90mph and Afridi just stands there and slams the ball straight back where it came from! Stunning six, very powerfully hit and clunking into the sightscreen. They may need a new ball here...
Tait to Afridi, no run Tait responds with a bouncer as Afridi charges down the track again. He was expecting the yorker again and couldn't lay bat on ball as the ball reared up at him
Tait to Afridi, 1 run slower ball to finish, very full and on leg stump. Tapped down to long-on

Nannes to Afridi, FOUR runs everything going Afridi's way now. Nannes slips in a short one, Afridi was on the front foot but aimed to pull over midwicket, top-edging up and over Tim Paine to pick up four!
Nannes to Afridi, 1 leg bye Nannes goes full this time, and they pick up one as the ball squirts off the boot/pad to square leg

Nannes to Umar Akmal, OUT Umar falls! He hadn't been quite so fluent today, gone for 25 from 21. He had 50 by the time he had faced 21 balls yesterday! Nannes flings one down short and from a wide angle, Umar goes to pull but top-edges straight up in the air. The fielders converge but Nannes calls for it and takes it. The scorecard will read caught-and-bowled but it was quite a catch, went miles in the air.

Nannes to Afridi, OUT two in two! Nannes on a hat-trick! Afridi looks to run the ball down to third man but it just bounced a little more than he expected, running off the face/top-edge and through to Paine. Big, big wicket and Australia are right back in this.

Nannes to Amir, FOUR runs edged! That would've landed in third slip's lap! But instead it's gone down to third man for four. Nannes manages a wry smile - he always seems to play the game in the right spirit
Nannes to Amir, no run short again outside off, Aamer tries to cut but is beaten
Hussey to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run too short to start, and carved away to deep cover
Hussey to Amir, 1 run tucked behind square on the off side, just the single
Hussey to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run drilled very hard indeed down to long-off, all along the ground
Hussey to Amir, 1 run slashed off the outer half of the bat to short third man, they scamper a quick single
Hussey to Abdul Razzaq, 1 run bouncer from Hussey! That was really short, and Razzaq had ample time to rock back and thump a pull out to deep midwicket

Hussey to Amir, (no ball) OUT drama! What's happened here? Hussey comes round the wicket and bowls one full on off stump. Aamer cracks the ball back to him, and the umpire calls no-ball as he's over-stepped ... but Hussey collects the ball in his follow-through and breaks the stumps at the non-strikers end, where Razzaq had backed up too far! So, it'll be a Free hit, but Australia have a very important wicket!
Hussey to Amir, SIX runs too short, Aamer hangs back and swipes the ball miles over wide long-on! Huge six, and valuable runs for Pakistan

O'Keefe to Umar Gul, OUT But that will! Well, it's just a replay of the last ball, except this time Gul swung across the line of a legitimate delivery and is bowled! A second wicket for O'Keefe on debut

O'Keefe to Shoaib Akhtar, 1 bye more drama! Well, Shoaib could've been out twice here! First he missed the ball completely as O'Keefe speared one in at leg stump, but it slips down the leg side. Shoaib is called through for a cheeky single but is slow to set off, and is almost run out at the other end!
O'Keefe to Amir, SIX runs Aamer is giving his team a great chance here! Another huge six nailed over long-on, wonderful clean strike
O'Keefe to Amir, 1 run very full this time, jammed out wide of midwicket for a single

O'Keefe to Shoaib Akhtar, OUT third wicket for O'Keefe! Well, Aamer was nailing them and Shoaib wanted to join in, charging down the track and swinging massively to leg ... except he misses the ball completely and it clatters into the leg stump. Well-bowled by O'Keefe, he has turned the ball an inch today but has been nice and accurate
O'Keefe to Ajmal, no run good finish, tossing it up on off stump and it's tapped back to the bowler
Tait to Amir, no run or does he? Tait comes over the wicket and sends down a short-ish delivery on middle and off, angling across the left-hander. Aamer can't lay bat on ball though
Tait to Amir, 1 run he gets bat on this one, dropping the ball to cover to pick up a quick single. Sensible really, better than just swinging and missing at everything
Tait to Ajmal, FOUR runs Saeed Ajmal, where have you been hiding? Tait fires one full outside off and Ajmal slashes him away powerfully between cover and point, all along the ground for four!
Tait to Ajmal, 1 run ah, there's the Ajmal we know, backing away to leg and toe-ending a swipe to long-on
Tait to Amir, 1 run slower ball, on a length. Aamer heaves, but the ball hits the bat near the splice and is chipped to long-on
Tait to Ajmal, 1 run Tait fires down a pinpoint yorker to finish as Ajmal backs to leg, but the batsman manages to jam down on it and they run a manic single.

These two sides, of course, played an epic semi final in the World Twenty20. As far as cricket's shortest format goes, few things will top that game. Speaking of semi finals, there is another World Cup game happening today - Uruguay are playing Holland - I'm told it will be a cracker, so if you are that way inclined check out our sister site ESPN Soccernet.

So, Pakistan reach 162 courtesy of some late biffing from Mohammad Aamer. They got 167 yesterday and Australia struggled, so this should be another tightly contested run-chase. It's all been a bit manic, really and we're all quite breathless with excitement here at Cricinfo Towers. While I dash off for a calming cuppa, have a look at Brydon's bulletin. It's almost as good as being at the game itself!

Right, we're ready to go again. Afridi has just led an impassioned team huddle. Can it inspire Shoaib to a better start than yesterday? He's going to get things underway against David Warner, who destroyed him yesterday.
Shoaib Akhtar to Warner, 1 run good start from the quick man, bounding in from a six mile run up, landing on a decent length and line, worked to midwicket for a single
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, FOUR runs good start from Clarke as opener, lifting what was actually a good rising delivery over the wicketkepper's head, one-bounce for four
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke enjoying the pace and carry, clipping a cut shot away for a couple
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, FOUR runs tough work already for Shoaib, he's not actually bowled that badly, but a fraction outside off and Clarke cuts firmly past point for four
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, no run good response here from the bowler, better length and good line, Clarke blocks firmly to cover

Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, no run oh it's all kicking off, plenty of stares and plenty of words from bowler and batsman, really top delivery, climbed from a length straight threw Clarke's attempted flay and Akmal took the ball well above his head

Amir to Warner, 1 leg bye Aamer is an altogether more lean and lithe prospect than Shoaib and starts well, full and following Warner outside leg, thuds off a flurry of bat and pad away to square leg for a single
Amir to Clarke, FOUR runs lovely shot from Michael Clarke, not butchering the ball as his opening partner may, just easing a cover drive over the infield for four
Amir to Clarke, no run Clarke happy to hand leg side of the ball as Aamer pushed it across him, aims another cover drive, but this time finds the fielder
Amir to Clarke, 1 run slightly back of a length from Aamer, pushed towards point for a quick single
Amir to Paine, no run good first ball to the new batsman, forces him back and into a defensive shot in a flash
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, no run this is seriously swift stuff from Shoaib, can still get it through in a hurry despite his age, he's probably lucky to get away with this, it was crashed to point
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, FOUR runs Clarke is really ticking, Shaib has got his adrenaline flowing, it was a touch short from the bowler and he clumped a pull shot wide of midwicket for four
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, 1 run lucky for the batsman this time, full and Clarke sliced it in the air down towards deep point, but the fielder could not get in in time to take the catch
Shoaib Akhtar to Clarke, 1 run slower ball, good thinking from Shoaib, Clarke read it though and threaded a well-timed drive to deep point

Shoaib Akhtar to Hopes, no run he may look like he's bowled 30 overs, and with a run up like his you can understand him looking a little weary, but Shoaib has got this straight through Hopes before he had a chance to play a shot
Amir to Clarke, no run Aamer glides into another quick delivery, lovely action he has, Clarke is equally graceful, timing a crisp drive down to mid off
Amir to Clarke, 1 run good from Aamer, Clarke edged leg side and the bowler followed up, cramping any room so it could only be pushed towards the covers for one
Amir to Hopes, 1 run Hopes gets a firm connection here, working it into the leg side for one
Amir to Clarke, FOUR runs lovely shot and the ground is stunned into silence. Fair to say it's a one-eyed crowd! Clarke edged down the wicket and crisply eased it past the bowler for four
Amir to Clarke, FOUR runs oh top shot! It was there for it, full and with a touch of width, but Clarke absolutely drilled it through cover for four
Shoaib Akhtar to Hopes, no run Shoaib is working up really good pace, full and straight and defended
Shoaib Akhtar to Hopes, no run well Hopes is looking a little startled here, flashing at thin air outside off stump
Shoaib Akhtar to Hopes, 1 run lovely shot, really good from Hopes, picked a slower ball and drove firmly towards cover where Afridi dives and pulls off an excellent save
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, 1 wide Shoaib just gets this one wrong, sliding it down the leg side
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, no run lovely ball this, on a good length, outside off stump, just offering to go away off the wicket, and Hussey aims a flat-footed waft
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, no run Shoaib is through him again and having a real word with Hussey, who backed away and swished at nothing outside off
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, 1 run slower ball to finish, nicely delivered, Hussey watches it carefully and pushed towards cover for a single
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run pretty gentle start, clipped to short fine leg for a quick single

Ajmal to Hopes, FOUR runs top shot this, really confident stuff from Hopes, went down very early for a reverse sweep, Ajmal fired it in quicker, but Hopes connected well and threaded it through point for four
Ajmal to Hopes, FOUR runs unlucky for the bowler here, Hopes went for a conventional sweep, and top-edged it over short fine leg for another boundary
Ajmal to Hopes, 1 run fired in much quicker and clipped away for a single towards midwicket
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run another single, just worked into the leg side
Ajmal to Hopes, no run doosra here, and not read by the batsman, gets a leading edge towards mid off
Umar Gul to Hussey, FOUR runs wow, Hussey has timed this perfectly, looked nothing more than a routine work to leg from a shortish ball but it sped between fine leg and square leg for four
Umar Gul to Hussey, 1 run follows up the boundary with a soft-handed push into the off side for a quick single
Umar Gul to Hopes, 1 run shoved it a touch shorter, Hopes slapped a front-foot pull, without much timing one-bounce to long on
Umar Gul to Hussey, 1 run good stuff this from Hussey, quietly pushed down the ground for a single

Umar Gul to Hopes, FOUR runs very good from Hopes, with the silence from the crowd you never know if these shots are timed, but it certainly was, Hopes pulling a shortish ball through midwicket for four
Umar Gul to Hopes, 1 run that's better from Gul, full and straight and dug out in front of midwicket for a single
Afridi to Hopes, no run starts well, speared into middle and blocked to cover
Afridi to Hopes, 1 run touch of spin here, but more Kumble than Warne, cut firmly to deep point for a single
Afridi to Hussey, 1 leg bye this time it's fired in towards the legs and thuds off bat and pad towards short fine leg for one
Afridi to Hopes, 2 runs nicely done from Hopes, he's doing a good job now, clipping firmly in front of midwicket for a couple
Afridi to Hopes, 2 runs and again, a touch short and Hopes pulled it carefully in front of midwicket for a couple more
Afridi to Hopes, no run quicker ball to finish and Hopes drives to cover
Umar Gul to Hussey, no run dot balls are almost as useful, and here it's driven firmly back to the bowler
Umar Gul to Hussey, no run dot ball again, Gul finding his range this over, tight line outside off, driven crisply but straight to Afridi at mid off, who has another chat with his bowler
Umar Gul to Hussey, 1 run this time there is a single, full and straight and clipped to long on for one
Umar Gul to Hopes, 1 run very good from Gul, there is nothing on offer here for the Australian batsmen, speared in full and straight and it's dug out to long on again

Umar Gul to Hussey, 3 runs touch of swing, first time we've seen that from Pakistan today, but it ends up going for three, as it's worked to deep midwicket where Umar fires in a throw that Gul fails to collect allowing a bonus third
Umar Gul to Hopes, 1 run once again it's full and straight, with a touch of indrift, and it's clipped for a single
Afridi to Hopes, 2 runs the batsmen are doing this well now, Pakistan under pressure, clipped to deep point for a swiftly taken couple
Afridi to Hopes, 1 run this time it's fired towards leg stump and worked towards deep square leg for a single
Afridi to Hussey, 2 runs two more, excellent running, it was carefully worked into the square leg region
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run Hussey this time clips it away off the front foot for a single to square leg
Afridi to Hopes, no run better from Afridi, nothing for Hopes to work with and blocked back to the bowler
Afridi to Hopes, 1 run clipped away for a leg side single to finish a good over for Australia
Ajmal to Hopes, 1 run a hint of turn in to the batsman, who backs away and slaps to backward point
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run easy single for Hussey, who just pushes the ball into the covers and sets off. The fielders are right back on the edge of the circle, plenty of opportunity for sneaky singles
Ajmal to Hopes, no run Hopes goes down on bended knee to slog sweep but the ball thumps into the pad. Big appeal from Ajmal, but the ball was going over as well as missing leg
Ajmal to Hopes, no run another attempted slog sweep as Ajmal keeps darting them in to leg stump, again he can't connect
Ajmal to Hopes, 1 run full toss clipped behind square on the leg side
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run drilled down to long-on
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run chipped to long-on
Afridi to White, 1 run nudged to wide long-on, Afridi is determined to stop them getting two and hares after the ball himself!
Afridi to Hussey, FOUR runs short, much too short and Afridi is kicking the turf in disgust! Hussey is not going to miss out on those, and pulls very hard infront of square to pick up a boundary
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run worked with plenty of bottom hand down to long-on
Afridi to White, 1 run short and wide outside off this time, and its carved out to the cover sweeper

Shoaib Akhtar to White, no run smell that! Well, Shoaib runs his fingers over this one as he slams it into the turf halfway down, but the ball spits up viciously off a length to scoot past the batsman's grille. Shoaib wanders down to have a polite word in his ear...
Shoaib Akhtar to White, 1 run forced out square on the off side off the back foot
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, 2 runs very full as Hussey backs away to leg, but he gets a good connection to drill the ball to long-off, where Umar Gul charges across and makes a good, sliding stop
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, (no ball) slower ball from Shoaib, outside off and Hussey can't get it away ... but he's over-stepped! That's a no-ball, so we have a Free hit coming up
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, FOUR runs Hussey capitalises on the free hit, stepping away to leg and scything a full ball through cover. Spanked! All along the ground, beating the cover sweeper
Shoaib Akhtar to Hussey, 1 run another quick yorker from Shoaib, but Hussey manages to jam it out to long-off

Shoaib Akhtar to White, 1 leg bye Shoaib charges in and raps the batsman's pads with an inswinging length delivery! Wow, he really looks pooped, barely has the energy to appeal for the lbw. It was slipping down leg though, so not even considered.
Afridi to White, FOUR runs White goes big, and he goes straight! He didn't send it for maximum, but collects a one-bounce four straight down the ground. Very strong shot
Afridi to White, no run fuller this time, slammed back to the bowler
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run driven out to long-off

Afridi to Hussey, FOUR runs fast offcutter from Afridi, but he's slipped onto Hussey's pads and the batsman has no trouble gliding the ball away very fine on the leg side to get off the mark with a boundary!
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run full, and worked to long-on
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run just too short, cut away infront of point
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run quick armball, wristily worked across the line and out to deep midwicket off the back foot
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run quick again, but also just too short and Hussey hops back and across to nudge to short fine leg

Ajmal to O'Keefe, no run O'Keefe has no idea about this one. I'm not sure he's ever faced a spinner of Ajmal's class before, and he doesn't pick the doosra at all, backing away to leg and thrusting his bat out. Lucky not to edge that
Ajmal to O'Keefe, no run very tentative again from O'Keefe, tapping defensively back down the track
Amir to Hussey, 1 run driven on the up down to long-off
Amir to O'Keefe, no run bouncer from Aamer, and it flies over the middle and leg stumps as O'Keefe ducks underneath it. Borderline wide, but the umpire calls one for the over
Amir to O'Keefe, no run slower-ball bouncer from Aamer this time, O'Keefe seemed to pick it and tried to send the ball into orbit, but couldn't get a touch on it!
Amir to O'Keefe, 1 run quick yorker this time, jammed out to the point fielder and Hussey calls him through for a scampered single

Amir to Hussey, FOUR runs classic Mike Hussey! What a shot at this stage of the innings, Aamer sent down a half-volley outside off and Hussey just nailed it through cover with a textbook drive. No need for anything innovative, he just slapped it right out of the middle, all along the ground. Fielders didn't even move
Amir to Hussey, 1 run pushed to long-off, and he keeps the strike
Ajmal to Hussey, 2 runs speared down on middle and leg, Hussey nurdles to leg and some very sharp running gets him two
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run ooh, that was the 'other one' from Ajmal, Hussey didn't quite pick it but chopped the ball into the covers for a quick single

Ajmal to O'Keefe, FOUR runs four runs for O'Keefe! His first in international cricket, and it's a decent one. Not a great ball from Ajmal, long-hop outside off and O'Keefe steps back to force through cover. Well-timed, and they boundary sweeper can't cut it off

Ajmal to O'Keefe, no run appeal for a stumping! Ajmal went fuller, and beat the edge as O'Keefe looked to run the ball down to third man. He dragged his foot forward as Kamran collected and whipped the bails off, but kept his foot grounded inside the crease. Not out.

Ajmal to O'Keefe, OUT this is an interesting one... the ball squirts behind square on the leg side off an inside edge and Hussey charges through for the single, O'Keefe is late to respond to the call as the throw is fired to the non-striker's end. Ajmal collects and breaks the stumps, but lets go of the ball as he does ... tough one for the third umpire... That's out! He only let go of the ball after the stumps were d
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run cracked wide of long-off, just the single though as Hussey will want to keep the strike
Umar Gul to Hussey, FOUR runs shot! Edgbaston falls silent as Hussey paddles a length ball very fine, wide of the short fine leg fielder for four!

Umar Gul to Hussey, FOUR runs four more! Hussey is playing so intelligently here, he would've seen that field change and clips a leg-stump half-volley out behind square on the leg side, right between the fielders! Gul under pressure now

Umar Gul to Hussey, no run what a response! Gul comes round the wicket to Hussey and fires in a yorker right at the toes, aimed straight at leg stump. The best Hussey can do is dig it out back to the bowler

Umar Gul to Nannes, 2 runs great fielding from Saeed Ajmal! Nannes inside edges to fine leg, that looked like four all the way but Ajmal charged round and threw his body down to stop it, keeping the ball inside the rope
Umar Gul to Nannes, 1 wide bouncer! Nannes ducks underneath it, but he didn't even have to, that ballooned over him and is rightfully called wide
Umar Gul to Nannes, no run driven down to long-off, they decide against the single though to keep Johnson on strike
Amir to Tait, no run how has that missed? Tait is beaten for pace by a full ball that shaves past the outside edge of the bat and the off stump
Amir to Tait, no run full and fast again, Tait just pushes it back to the bowler
Amir to Tait, 1 run Tait backs way to leg this time and lifts the ball to long-on. Flat-batted it, but didn't time it at all
Amir to Nannes, FOUR runs what a shot from Nannes! Full on the off stump and Nannes cracks it very hard in the air, and straight! Long-off charges round but can't cut it off. Nannes still believes...
Amir to Nannes, no run Nannes heaves mightily to leg now, but connects only with fresh air as the ball shoots over the top of leg stump
Umar Gul to Tait, 1 run Tait backs away to leg as Gul fires in an inswinging yorker, slapping the ball to extra cover. Just a single though
Umar Gul to Nannes, no run yorker again from Gul, wide of off and it shoots underneath Nannes' bat as he tries to swish through the off side
Umar Gul to Nannes, SIX runs six! Gul misses his mark with the yorker, turning it into a half-volley. Nannes closed his eyes and swung, connecting well to send the ball sailing over long-off!

So, Pakistan restrict Australia to 151 to take the Twenty20 series 2-0. Their batting was a little more patchy today, but a team effort took them to 162. The bowlers looked like a good unit, though, and Shoaib looked much more fluent today. Mohammad Aamer bowled with pace and intelligence to finish with 3 for 27, and there was no weak link in the attack. For Australia, Steve O'Keefe bowled very well to pick up three wickets
Pakistan won by 11 runs
Player of the match is Mohammad Amir, PAK
